text: hi this is Seema and I am back with a
new lesson on using the word through
well this is a very common word and I
can tell you for a fact that you use it
almost 20 times every day well a lot of
us don't know but the word true can be
used in various different ways depending
on what the meaning of the sentence is
supposed to be so let us look at the
different ways you can use the word
through well the first way to use the
word through is when you want to
indicate a movement from one side to
other side okay so we indicate movement
let's look at our sentence the sentence
says I drove through the city last night
so let's say for example this out here
is a city okay I drove from this end to
this end and that's when I use the word
through to indicate movement from one
point to another point so I say I drove
through the city last night our next way
of using the word through is to indicate
a passage when I say a passage I mean
like a physical passage from one end to
another
okay so this is a movement we're talking
about and you're I'm talking about a
passage which refers to an actual
physical road or a physical passage so
let's have a look at the sentence it
says there is a side road through the
forest okay so here's your forest okay
and there is an actual physical road an
actual physical passage through the
forest and that's why I use the word
through because I'm talking about an
actual Road an actual passage of
physical passage that is from one end to
another or I could say something like I
walked through the forest very slowly
now I'm talking about a passage that is
right there in the middle of the forest
okay let's move on to our next way of
using the word through another way we
can use the word through is when we want
to talk about going in and out of a
process or shall I say treatment okay so
there is a certain procedure you've got
to follow a certain treatment you've got
to go through that's when you use the
word through okay so a sentence like the
matter went through the managers hand so
maybe you know in your office there is a
legal matter going on so it has to
follow a certain procedure now this has
to be dealt with by with a manager so
that's when you will use the word
through because you are saying that this
procedure or treatment has to be gone
through and therefore you say the
mater went through the managers hand if
I go through a surgery I can say I went
through a very painful surgery because
I'm talking about going in and out of a
process or a treatment and the other way
we can use the word or the expression
through is when we are talking about
relationships and when I mean
relationships I'm talking about
relationships in your family your blood
relationships so I can say something
like we are related through our ends so
you and I we're cousins because we are
related through our ABS or I know Bill
through you know a mutual friend so it
could be blood relationships or any
other relationship which connects people
that's how you got come to know each
other and that's when you use the word
through once again um and the next way
of using the word through is when you
want to talk about a way of spreading
some kind of news or some kind of gossip
okay so let's look at our sentence our
sentence says I got to know the news
through the internet or I got to know
the good news through your parents
so you're I'm using the word through
because I'm saying that someone or
somehow the news got spread through
someone and therefore I use the word
through so I got to know of the fact
that you've passed your exams through
your best friend
so that talks about spreading or a way
of getting something known to you
because someone has spread that news
or information another very common way
of using the word through is when we
want to talk about a set of condition or
maybe a certain set of circumstances
that are there in front of you so I can
say something like I went through a
torture yesterday while writing my exams
so I'm talking about a set of condition
so I am really not feeling very good
while writing my paper and that's a
condition of my mind at that point in
time and therefore I use the word
through because I say I went through a
torture yesterday while giving my test
or I could say something like I went
through a very tough time trying to
explain it to my mother so that's a set
of condition and the next way or the
next way we can use the word through is
when we are trying to talk about a
period of time
okay so if I work from Monday to
Saturday most of us say I work Monday to
Saturday but you can use the word
through instead and say the sentence
like I am at work Monday through
Saturday so in that case you don't have
to use the word from because you can say
I am at work Monday through Saturday
okay so that indicates a period of time
and another way of using the word
through is when I want to talk about or
indicate something from the beginning
to the end to the end of like a process
or a procedure so a movie is like you
know something that you have got to go
through from the beginning to the end so
if I was laughing from the beginning to
the end of a movie because it was very
funny I can use the word through instead
by saying I was laughing all through the
movie in other words I was laughing from
the beginning to the end of the movie
okay and the last way of using the word
through is when we want to talk about or
something that happens because or due to
something or somebody so basically in
these cases the word through is merely
used to replace the word because or do
two so I can say something like it was
all through her that we lost our money
we went gambling so instead of saying we
lost our money because or we lost our
money due to her I can replace it with
the word through instead and say it was
all through her that we lost our money
well that's it for me on this lesson
with using the word through as you can
see there are various ways to use the
word through well I'll be back with some
more lessons until
we say goodbye
